intro: Lantana sandersii, commonly known as the sanders' lantana, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, brightly colored flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and salt spray. It produces small, oval-shaped leaves and has a shrub-like growth habit. Lantana sandersii is often used in landscaping due to its ornamental value and ability to thrive in harsh environments.
